Detailed Description

Spiking neural network connection.

This class abstract the behaviour of a spiking neural network connection. It is composed by source and target neuron, an index, a connection delay...

Author:
Jesus Garrido

Richard Carrillo

Date:
August 2008

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Interconnection::Interconnection (  ) 

Default constructor.

It creates a new interconnection object without source or target neuron.

Definition at line 7 of file Interconnection.cpp.

Interconnection::Interconnection ( int  NewIndex,
Neuron *  NewSource,
Neuron *  NewTarget,
float  NewDelay,
int  NewType,
float  NewWeight,
float  NewMaxWeight,
WeightChange *  NewWeightChange,
float  NewActivity[3],
float  NewLastSpikeTime 
)

Constructor with parameters.

It creates and initializes a new interconnection object with the parameters.

Parameters:
NewIndex The interconnection index in the network configuration file.
NewSource Source neuron of this connection.
NewTarget Target neuron of this connection.
NewDelay Delay of this connection.
NewType Connection type (excitatory, inhibitory, electrical coupling...) of this connection. The meaning of a value is depend on the neuron model.
NewWeight Synaptic weight of this connection.
NewMaxWeight Maximum synaptic weight of this connection.
NewWeightChange Learning (or weight change) rule associated to this connection.
NewActivity Last activity register of this connection.
NewLastSpikeTime Time of the last propagated spike in this connection.
